entry.title: Pacific Power prepares for possible weather-related outages
entry.summary: 11:05 a.m. Dec. 16, 2025 With significant storms forecasted in the region, Pacific Power is prepared to respond to weather-related outages that may occur. The local power company said in a statement that it is monitoring conditions throughout Oregon and Washington over the coming days. Gusty winds and heavy rains could cause power outages and...

entry.title: Heavy rains cause FedEx truck to crash on I-5
entry.summary: 11:05 a.m. Dec. 16, 2025 A FedEx delivery truck crashed during inclement weather on Monday afternoon in northern Douglas County. A report from Oregon State Police said around 4:30 p.m. the driver of the delivery truck lost control of the vehicle while negotiating a turn on Interstate-5 northbound at mile-marker 162 near Anlauf. Heavy rains...

entry.title: Myrtle Creek woman injured in rollover accident Monday
entry.summary: 11:00 a.m. Dec. 16, 2025 Douglas County Sheriff’s deputies responded to a rollover accident Monday morning in a rural area of Mrytle Creek. According to a DCSO report, a 55-year-old Myrtle Creek woman was injured around 10:20 a.m. after her vehicle left the roadway for unknown reasons and rolled before coming to a rest on...

entry.title: Riddle man injured in crash through fence
entry.summary: 10:20 a.m. Dec. 16, 2025 A Riddle man was hurt in a vehicle accident Monday night in the Myrtle Creek area. According to the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office, a 21-year-old man was injured while riding in a car that crashed through a fence around 9:45 p.m. in the 300 block of Yokum Road. The vehicle...

entry.title: HYDROLOGIC OUTLOOK FOR HEAVY RAIN IN REGION
entry.summary: December 16, 2025 4:00 a.m. The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Hydrologic Outlook for heavy rain expected in Douglas, Coos, Curry and Josephine counties. Forecasters said rain is expected through Tuesday night with the highest amounts of around one to two inches from Curry County into western Josephine County. A weather statement...

entry.title: COUNTY COMMISSIONERS RECOGNIZE ZIMMER AND KEITH FOR RECENT AWARDS
entry.summary: December 26, 2025 3:50 a.m. Douglas County Commissioners recently recognized Department Director at Douglas County’s Salmon Harbor Division Jim Zimmer, and Fairgrounds Director Ciera Keith for their respective accolades. A county release said that includes offices at the courthouse, Douglas...

entry.title: LUNCHBOX EXPRESS TO DELIVER FREE MEALS OVER WINTER BREAK
entry.summary: December 16, 2025 3:20 a.m. The Roseburg School District’s Lunchbox Express van will once again deliver free meals over winter break. A Roseburg Schools release said this will help ensure children have access to healthy food and steady support while school is out. Meals will be distributed December 22nd and 23rd and December 29th and...

entry.title: CCD BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT RELOCATES TO DOWNTOWN ROSEBURG
entry.summary: December 16, 2025 3:05 a.m. In the KQEN Business Spotlight: CCD Business Development Corporation has announced that it has moved their Roseburg office to the heart of downtown Roseburg. A release said the move brings their team closer to the vibrant center of community and economic activity and enhances their ability to support local businesses...

entry.title: SAVING GRACE WITH CHRISTMAS PET DONATION DRIVE
entry.summary: December 16, 2025 2:50 a.m. Saving Grace Humane Society has a Christmas Pet Donation Drive underway. Lookingglass Brewery in Winston is partnering with Saving Grace to help fill their pet pantry. A donation box is set up to receive items to help. That includes things like easy cheese, peanut butter, dry dog and puppy food,...

entry.title: OSAA Approves New Classifications, Places Roseburg in Southwest Hybrid League
entry.summary: OSAA approved new athletic classifications for 2026–2030, placing Roseburg High School in a newly formed 6A–5A Southwest Hybrid League alongside Grants Pass, Medford schools, and three 5A programs.

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOR ALLEGED THEFT OF CHRISTMAS WREATH

An RPD report said at 4:00 a.m. officers contacted the 52-year-old from Bandon at the Roseburg VA. He had been detained by VA police for stealing the holiday greenery from a store in the 900...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN ON ROBBERY, TRESPASS AND THEFT CHARGES

entry.title: OSAA adopts four-year classification and districting plan that brings changes for Roseburg, South Umpqua and North Douglas
entry.summary: The Oregon School Activities Association Executive Board voted to approve a new classification and districting plan during a meeting Monday in Wilsonville.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 12.15.25
entry.summary: City of Roseburg Parks and Recreation Program Manager Vel Ligon talks about a master plan update for Stewart Park. A survey is available for public input through Friday.

entry.title: WYDEN, COLLEAGUES INTRODUCE LEGISLATION TO VODIFY FEE-FREE DAYS
entry.summary: December 15, 2025 10:40 a.m. On Friday, U.S. Senator Ron Wyden said he had joined Senate and House colleagues to introduce legislation that would guarantee that visitors can enter National Parks and other federal lands free-of-charge six days a year. entry.title: WISH UPON A STAR 12.15.25
entry.summary: Wish #6 – from Brooke Communications and Rogue Credit Union – Josh is a single father and has gone without care for his teeth for too long. Some help is provided from Wish Upon a Star.

entry.title: City offices, library to close for Christmas, New Year’s
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — City of Roseburg buildings will be closed Dec. 25-26 for the Christmas holiday, and Jan. 1 for the New Year holiday.

entry.title: DR Johnson Memorial Timber Truckers Light Parade passes through south county
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — Dominic and Shirley Corbin typically sit on the back of a decorated Norton Forest Products truck in the DR Johnson Memorial Timber Truckers Light Parades; at least, that's what they've done for the past five years.

entry.title: Pierson Memorial Wreaths Across America honors over 6,000 veterans in Roseburg
entry.summary: Saturday's Wreaths Across America sprinkled across the United States with people in over 5,000 locations coming together to remember, honor and teach.

entry.title: STORM SYSTEM BRINGING MULTIPLE ROUNDS OF RAIN THIS WEEK
entry.summary: December 15, 2025 4:10 a.m. A storm system moving west to east is expected to bring multiple rounds of rain to the Umpqua Valley this week. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that rain will hit the region on Monday and Tuesday, with a brief...

Information from Tenmile Rural Fire District said the agency responded to a reported structure fire on Moonhill Road. The TRFD fire chief arrived in just under ten...

entry.title: OREGON 42 LOOKINGGLASS CREEK TO I-5 PROJECT PAUSED UNTIL SPRING
entry.summary: December 15, 2025 3:50 a.m. A contractor for the Oregon Department of Transportation has finished work for the season on the Oregon 42 Lookingglass Creek to I-5 Project. Dan Latham of ODOT said on Friday, Rocky Mountain Construction finished the concrete traffic separators along the center of the median on Highway 42 between Rolling Hills...

entry.title: STILL TIME TO APPLY FOR CITY OF ROSEBURG FALL TOURISM GRANTS
entry.summary: December 15, 2025 3:30 a.m. Local businesses and nonprofit organizations planning events to attract visitors, still have time to apply for a fall tourism grant from the City of Roseburg. A city release said the Roseburg Community Development Department and Roseburg Economic Development Commission are taking applications for the grants until 5:00 p.m. on Wednesday,...

entry.title: UMPQUA PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION DISTRICT BOARD MEETS MONDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: December 15, 2025 3:20 a.m. The Umpqua Public Transportation District Board of directors will meet on Monday night at 5:30 p.m. Jennifer Boardman from the Oregon Department of Transportation will provide an update regarding key areas like governance and board responsibilities, compliance requirements, procurement and contracting practices, funding opportunities, board member training expectations and alignment...

entry.title: FOUNDATION AWARDS OVER $200,000 TO LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS
entry.summary: December 15, 2025 3:05 a.m. The Oregon Community Foundation recently awarded just over $200,000 to several organizations in Douglas County. The funding was part of $5.1 million given out by OCF’s Community Grants program to organizations working to expand access to education, health services, economic opportunity, arts and culture, and more. A release said grants...

entry.title: FESTIVAL OF LIGHTS CONTINUES THROUGH JANUARY 1ST
entry.summary: December 15, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights continues nightly through January 1st. Presented by the Roseburg Rotary Club, the 33rd annual event features more than 500,000 lights and 90 displays at River Forks Park, northwest of Roseburg. A $10 ticket allows one vehicle visit to both the Festival of Lights and...

entry.title: Travel Alert for Drivers Heading North: OR 229 Closed in Lincoln County Due to Landslide
entry.summary: Drivers traveling north or toward the Oregon coast should be aware that OR 229 in Lincoln County is closed between Kernville and Siletz due to a landslide that removed part of the roadway. No detour is available and the closure is expected to be long term.

entry.title: Volunteers Place 7,000 Wreaths at Roseburg National Cemetery to Honor Veterans
entry.summary: More than 7,000 wreaths were placed at Roseburg National Cemetery as volunteers gathered for the John Pierson Memorial Wreaths Across America Ceremony. Each wreath marked a veteran’s service, with names spoken aloud to ensure no one is remembered as just a number.
